title: What are some songs with a spoken intro? - Quora

response.answer_text: Isn't the spoken intro kinda fun? Sometimes it's the artist, or in other cases, a narrator, but I do love to hear a track start with a spoken intro. Here's a few: Louis Armstrong: “What A Wonderful World”  The Alan Parsons Project: “The Fall Of The House Of Usher”  Meatloaf: “You Took The Words Right Outta My Mouth”  The Doors: “The Soft Parade”  The Moody Blues: “Ride My See Saw”  Eric Burdon & The Animals: “San Franciscan Nights”  Golden Earring: “Twilight Zone”  Pink Floyd: “Alan's Psychedelic Breakfast”  David Bowie: “Future Legend/Diamond Dogs”  Funkadelic: “Maggot Brain”  There can always be a few more, but here I stop at ten.

Not sure if you mean a voice opens up the track or that the first words in a song are spoken rather than sung, so I'll jus wing it: "Here Comes My Girl" — Tom Petty & The Heartbreakers"Let's Go Crazy" — Prince"I'm Open" — Pearl Jam"The Number of the Beast" — Iron Maiden"The Prisoner" — Iron Maiden"Modern Love" — David Bowie"Alexander the Great" — Iron Maiden"Crazy" — Aerosmith"Little Acorns" — The White Stripes"Black Widow" — Alice Cooper"Gold Rush Brides" (MTV Unplugged) — 10,000 Maniacs
